intro: Heinsia myrmoecia, commonly known as the Mexican heath, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, evergreen leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Heinsia myrmoecia is often grown as an ornamental plant in gardens due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
